intro: Paraboea thorelii, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. It has a low-growing habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water. Paraboea thorelii is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in regions with limited rainfall.
